title: Best RX 7800 XT - overall, budget, and overclocking picks
text: Here are our thoughts on the best RX 7800 XT models. The AMD Radeon RX 7800 XT made a thunderous entry into the market following its recent launch, with critical acclaim echoing throughout the tech community. Following the positive feedback this GPU generation has received, we present an insightful guide to help you identify the best RX 7800 XT tailored to your needs. While there’s not too much gen-on-gen improvement in terms of rasterization performance over the AMD Radeon RX 6800 XT, the RX 7800 XT offers a variety of features not available from its predecessor. Overall, its AI accelerator cores can power more advanced AI workloads such as upscaling, as well as better ray tracing performance. If you’re interested in investing in this card, we’ve outlined some of the best models of the 7800 XT for you here.  Our methodology for selecting the best RX 7800 XT is a fusion of rigorous testing, user feedback, and industry benchmarks. By putting each card through a series of performance evaluations, we gauge its real-world efficiency, stability, and overall experience. Heat management, noise levels, and power draw are just a few of the specs we examine closely. Furthermore, beyond the technical metrics, we factor in the reliability and reputation of the manufacturer, post-purchase support, and warranty conditions. The community’s voice is invaluable; hence, user reviews, experiences, and feedback are integral components of the decision-making process. On the whole, AMD is looking to dominate the mid-range GPU market with the release of the 7800 XT and the slightly cheaper 7700 XT. With support for its latest FidelityFX Super Resolution (FSR) 3, as well as increased rendering power from the underlying RDNA 3 architecture, the card is a fantastic choice for gamers looking for a GPU upgrade that provides 1440p frame rates without breaking the bank. It stands out as an alternative to other market favorite cards such as the NVIDIA Geforce RTX 4080, despite not having the favorable DLSS. In order to make the most out of this card, you should consider pairing it with one of our picks of the best CPU for the 7800 XT.   The PowerColor Red Devil Radeon RX 7800 XT is a beast in the GPU world. It boasts an impressive 16GB GDDR6 video memory, operating on a 256-bit bus width. With a base clock speed of 1.8GHz, which can be boosted up to 2.59GHz, it’s certainly poised to deliver outstanding performance for high fps gaming and other demanding applications. For users who prioritize a quiet computing environment, the Red Devil’s solid thermal capability ensures that your system remains cool without making a ruckus. The slight overclock that comes with this PowerColor card adds a cherry on top by offering enhanced performance in select applications. However, it’s not all roses. The design is pretty basic; Power Color’s choice of a plain black shroud with a touch of red might not appeal to everyone. Additionally, those who wish to sidestep the large GPUs dominating the NVIDIA market will be disappointed as the Red Devil’s length might present compatibility issues for smaller cases.   The ASRock Challenger Radeon RX 7800 XT is positioned to be a contender in the gaming GPU arena, with specifications designed for avid gamers. It’s loaded with 16GB GDDR6 on a 256-bit memory bus and boasts a boost clock that can reach up to 2475 MHz. The GPU demands power via its 2 x 8-pin connectors and offers a plethora of display options with 3 DisplayPort™ 2.1 and an HDMI™ 2.1 port. The Challenger’s dual-fan design is more than just aesthetics. It’s strategically optimized to deliver top-notch cooling, ensuring your gaming sessions aren’t interrupted by heat-induced hiccups. ASRock‘s unique Striped Ring Fan enhances the card’s airflow capability, giving it an edge in the cooling department. While the card has plenty going for it, what stands out is the 0dB Silent Cooling feature. In a world where silence is golden, especially during intense gaming or work sessions, this GPU ensures noiseless operations when the system is cool. The fan only spins when necessary, so you get the best of both worlds: optimal cooling and silence.   The Gigabyte Gaming OC Radeon RX 7800 XT provides gamers and enthusiasts with a potent punch of power. With its 16GB GDDR6 video memory, 256-bit bus width, and 60 compute units, it is designed for serious gaming and high-performance applications. Running on a base clock speed of 1.8GHz that can skyrocket up to 2.56GHz, this card packs a punch. It’s supported by 3840 stream processors and 60 ray accelerators, all on a PCI-E Generation 4 interface. Its dimensions make it a medium-sized card, but with its 302mm length, certain build considerations are essential. Gigabyte’s Gaming OC version of the 7800 XT stands out for its strong boosting capability. Those in the hunt for additional performance improvements in games and applications will appreciate this. The card’s thermal performance also deserves a mention. Featuring alternate spinning fans, airflow pressure increases, ensuring the GPU remains cool during intense gaming sessions.   The ASRock STEEL LEGEND Radeon RX 7800 XT is a striking entry in the RX 7800 XT lineup. Operating on a PCI Express 4.0 x16 interface, this GPU boasts a core clock of 2213 MHz which can surge up to a boost clock of 2520 MHz. It’s equipped with 3840 stream processors and a generous 16GB GDDR6 memory with a 256-bit interface. This particular model supports DirectX 12 Ultimate and OpenGL 4.6, ensuring that gamers have access to the latest graphic technologies. On the port side, it’s equipped with one HDMI 2.1 and three DisplayPort 2.1 interfaces, allowing for multi-monitor setups. For those with ASRock motherboards that support Polychrome SYNC, synchronization between the GPU and motherboard’s lighting is seamless. But it’s not just about the lights; the triple-fan design, combined with the stylish metal backplate and Striped Axial Fan, showcases ASRock’s commitment to both form and function.   The RX 7800 XT, being one of the top contenders in the current graphics card race, boasts a myriad of features that appeal to both hardcore gamers and professional content creators. At its core, the GPU offers outstanding rasterization capabilities, significantly outpacing many of its contemporaries. Featuring 16GB VRAM and plenty of memory bandwidth, this card shines in 1440p, well supported by its Navi 32 GPU. Additionally, the RX 7800 XT also offers several models and variants from different manufacturers. Each variant may come with its cooling solutions, factory overclock settings and design aesthetics. From triple-fan configurations to robust metal backplates, potential buyers will need to weigh the importance of cooling efficiency against the physical size of the card, especially for those with compact PC builds. As a mid-range card, we’ve made sure to choose 7800 XT models that don’t vary too much from the launch price of $500 so that they still remain affordable for the target audience. If this is still out of your budget, you could consider checking out our picks of the best budget GPUs in 2023 for a more affordable gaming rig upgrade.   As the gaming landscape continues to evolve, the demand for powerful GPUs grows exponentially. The RX 7800 XT series showcases AMD’s prowess in delivering top-tier graphics performance for the modern gamer and enthusiast. From the impeccable build of the PowerColor Red Devil to the sleek design of the ASRock STEEL LEGEND, the overclocking prowess of the Gigabyte Gaming OC, and the value proposition of the ASRock Challenger, there’s a variant tailored for every type of user. It’s evident that the RX 7800 XT has set new standards in the GPU realm, both in terms of performance and design aesthetics.
